Idol Showdown Next Fes SUN, MAY PST SUN, MAY EST SUN, MAY GMT MON, MAY WIB MON, MAY JST Features Several features have been to Idol Showdown Next Fes. They include the following Quick A online option that allows players to swiftly join an matchmade lobby. Players can now utilize the training mode while awaiting a match. Various Performance Updates And Improvements Tutorials We have updated the tutorials to reflect the altered gameplay mechanics discussed below. We recommend that both and returning players visit to see what has changed. Universal Gameplay Thank you for continuing to support Idol Showdown. We have been working hard on delivering a Idol Showdown experience based on feedback. This is a major revision to almost all aspects of the. Our goals with this include Encouraging more interactive through Providing more defensive options. Reducing the number of checkmate situations. Creating a less volatile and more stable. Improving balance between characters. Improving balance within a character s kit by nerfing dominant and oppressive tools while buffing underutilized options. Lots of have been made within Idol Showdown Next Fes too many to easily fit into notes. Much of the frame data within the has changed, so we d to ask our players to explore themselves to find out exactly what is different. Throughout these notes we will highlight the biggest within the Next Fes. Mechanic Super Chat Reversal While blocking, if you hold forward and press M and H at the same time, you can do an invincible attack that does no damage but pushes the opponent back. This costs superchat bars. This gives an additional option to get out of an opponent s pressure. Mechanic Jab chains You can chain light attacks into themselves even on whiff. Certain characters will have different limits on how many times they can chain jab into itself. Mechanic Invulnerable Backdashes Backdashes now have full invulnerability on startup up to a certain point. This can help escape some oppressive situations. Mechanic Additional Simple inputs You can now perform different strength variants of special moves by pressing the special button in addition to the strength of the special move you desire. For example, if you are playing Korone and hold back and press special and heavy at the same time, you will get EX chainsaw. Various other universal General Balance You are no longer able to combo off of meter frame invincible moves. You can not superchat cancel or call a collab during a frame invincible or armored move. Moves with frame armor now lose their grab protection on wakeup. Generally, EX moves that provide frame advantage have had their advantage dramatically reduced. OTG moves now have an IPS limit of. After a move hits OTG, the opponent will be sent instantly into the IPS state. Moves with disjointed hitboxes have been given proper hurtboxes with a few exceptions. There are no longer any frame head invul moves. The fastest head invul moves in the now come out on frame. Now, when performing an instant block, the rewarded superchat will vary depending on the damage of the move blocked. Burst has a slower startup but a slightly bigger hitbox. Grabs have a shorter range. Grab tech has a longer time before both players can act again, increased pushback, and increased superchat gain. Frame data of all universal overheads has been standardized. When moves are blocked in the corner, they now have more pushback. Other You can no longer steal the corner by jumping into the corner. There is now a buffer for being able to perform dashes. This should help with micro dashes in certain combo routes, notably Ollie s. An additional visual effect has been a lightning effect to signify moves with unusually long hitstun. Character Ninomae Ina nis Witty Artistic Ina is a midrange charge character who controls space with her tentacle attacks. She unleashes latent power from the Ancient Ones when the opportunity arises, leaving her opponents without an inkling as to what hit them. Something unique to Ina is that she has visual indicators for when she has charged her charge attacks. If you have down charge, the halo will glow. If you have back charge, the book will glow. Existing Character Fubuki We wanted Fubuki to be a versatile character with a particular strength in patient, reactive. While Korone was shaped to be more, we wanted to emphasize Fubuki s power in neutral. In addition, several were made to help Fubuki make better use of her Idol Skill. These help Fubuki feel more distinct as a character and help compensate for some tools Fubuki lost due to universal system. Highlights Mechanic When performing a special move using simple inputs, the move will never be an SSR. This allows players to hold onto stocked Burger Fox or Pity SSRs while still having access to Fubuki s specials. Fubuki s Burger will now grant guaranteed SSR charges instead of. However, Fubuki is now capped to holding only guaranteed SSR charges at once. SSR QCB The SSR variants of the move will now cause a wallsplat instead of wallbounce when performed near the corner, and no longer cause a midscreen. This will prevent the juggled opponent from being put into impossible positions when the SSR occurs at specific parts of the screen. SSR DD Frame full invulnerability. Changed to reflect DD head invulnerability frames. Korone with Korone are focused on making her less powerful and more focused. Korone is currently a character due to her high damage and oppressive pressure. However, Korone has very neutral and defensive options, making her overshadow many other characters. In this, we wanted to provide Korone more of an identity as well as give other characters a chance to shine. We are doing this by accentuating Korone as a powerful pressure character, while nerfing her neutral and defensive. Highlights Super Input Korone can now access her supers separately with QCF S and QCB QCF S performs her super directly without performing the uppercut super on whiff. QCB S triggers the uppercut super which is fast and retains invul frames. Korone s DD S will no longer cost any meter. This gives Korone a very powerful tool in both pressure and in combos. Korone s now has an extended hurtbox and less forward movement, pushback, blockstun, and frame advantage in order to make the move less abusable. Korone s Chainsaw special moves have been significantly reworked and have sprites. The most significant include All chainsaws have increased recovery time Light Chainsaw no longer has any projectile invulnerability Heavy chainsaw has increased startup. They deal more chip damage than before. Suisei We imagine Suisei as a powerful pressure character with an oppressive vortex and among the strongest offense in the. However, as a tradeoff, Suisei intentionally struggles with limited defensive options. We feel Suisei meets her intended playstyle well and wanted to preserve this identity in this. However, we thought that her plan was too dimensional and relied on a few particularly powerful tools. To this end, we made adjustments that buffed and nerfed certain parts of her kit to make her use a wider variety of options in her offense. Highlights In order to preserve her identity as a character with limited defensive tools, Suisei is the only character in the whose backdash does not have any invul frames. As a tradeoff, she retains her backdash speed, which is now by far the fastest backdash in the. Super Input Suisei no longer needs to install her supers. She can now directly into both. The forward super is accessed by QCF S and the anti air super is accessed by QCB However in exchange she lost all invulnerability on them. QCF H has armor on top of it, but the armor does not activate immediately. This is to give it more of a use in neutral as well as add an additional call out option for Suisei. QCF L is now more negative on block. Crouching M s startup has been slowed down and been given a hurtbox during its active frames. In exchange, Standing H now connects from Crouching M even at its furthest ranges. Suisei s DF M slide has increased frame advantage and a longer duration, giving her another option. Suisei is cute in this too. Sora Sora is a hybrid character who retains decent pressure tools. Although Sora is currently a very powerful character, we wanted to preserve Sora s identity, as she is a very unique character Therefore, Sora remains relatively unchanged aside from targeted nerfs to her most oppressive and options. Highlights Forward M s hurtbox has been extended and given a much slower startup. QCF L is now a projectile with a hefty attack level. QCB mines now away when Sora is hit. Ayame Ayame was previously a character that relied heavily on a few powerful tools such as her DD H invincible reversal, which could be combo d out of. Due to universal to invulnerable special attacks, Ayame lost what was previously a core part of her identity. In order to compensate for this change, we decided to buff other parts of her kit to more evenly distribute her power across her kit. Our goal was to make her feel mostly similar, but use a wider portion of her moveset. Highlights Rekka Followups Ayame s Light Rekka Series now has additional followups M is a low. H followup is an overhead. The additional have been from her QCFH rekka series. However, this Rekka now pops up opponents for additional combo opportunities. Jumping Special saw little use. To remedy this, her Jumping Special will now groundbounce when hitting Aerial opponents. In addition we have given it an increased downwards hitbox. Sweep is a move that saw little use. It has been given additional range as well as been made easier to use in combos. Coco Due to universal to OTG, we had to rework some of Coco s combo structure. As a result some of her moves have fairly different combo structure allows Coco to land more fire attacks than before within a single combo Due to this, we have scaling to fire damage when used within a combo. Highlights Sweep now vacuums opponents in, allowing it to be used in combos. QCB M now counts as a projectile, giving it the ability to clash with other projectiles. To replace OTG no longer being able to combo, now applies fire damage. places the opponent slightly closer to you to help keep Coco s pressure going. Aki We felt that Aki didn t have a clear vision and relied too much on gimmicks. In this Aki has been significantly reworked to fit the role of a proper zoner. Her fireballs were tweaked to cover more approach angles as well as do more chip damage against blocking opponents. In exchange for additional zoning options, we have toned down her ability to mix up the opponent. Highlights Specials Aki s projectiles have been reworked. QCF L and M diagonally downwards at slightly different angles. QCF H is a straight multi hit projectile. The QCB series are now projectiles as well, the L and M version serve as her anti air projectiles. QCB H is a delayed multi hit projectile. Muki moves have been moved to the down down inputs. Aki s teleports have a charge motion input down up. In addition they were reworked to move her backwards instead of forwards. EX teleport is now invincible on startup. Aki s normal attacks have increased in attack level, improving her blockstrings. DD S now has a different buff. Instead of making her projectiles home in, it instead adds an additional hit to her projectiles, giving her an edge in projectile wars as well has giving her better frame advantage on both block and hit. is now more plus on hit and less punishable on block. Hitting at the right angle allows for followups. Botan Botan has some awkward parts to her kit, but overall is a solid character. Most of Botan s have been made in order to compensate for Botan s losses due to universal mechanics adjustments. Highlights Super Botan has a super accessed by QCB This move has an invincible startup, followed by a barrage of bullets. As a result of the universal to frame armor moves on wakeup, Botan shopping cart is now weak to meaty grabs and can not be made safe or combo off of using Superchat Cancels. The addition of this move provides Botan with a reversal option as well as an additional option to convert from longer ranged pokes. DD M has received an additional low followup by hitting light. The jump arc of DD M goes further. Crouching M s hitbox has been extended. It has more hurtbox and slightly increased startup to compensate. Grenades now away. Pekora Pekora had some good pressure but suffered from an unbalanced moveset, with certain extremely powerful tools overshadowing other moves. due to universal OTG, she lost some of her power so were made to help keep her OTG useful. These were made to reduce her oppressiveness in both her pressure sequences and her zoning. We targeted the most powerful moves in her kit, while rounding out moves that were previously overshadowed. She is still in both areas, but should be easier to deal with. Highlights QCB L Pekora moves backwards less after launching a rocket. DD H TNT now goes away on hit and has reduced frame advantage.
